newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE SEEKS BLACKS FOR BINDURA STAKE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE SEEKS BLACKS FOR BINDURA STAKE.

text.p: The Zimbabwean government is seeking black investors to take up a 22 percent stake in nickel producer Bindura which it was offered last year by South African mining giant Anglo American Corporation , the Financial Gazette reported on Thursday.
The Gazette quoted senior government officials as saying the cash-strapped government wanted to offload shares worth Z$280 million Anglo American offered it last year in its nickel mine.
Government and Anglo American officials were unavailable for comment.

"We are currently looking for serious black investors with money so that we can sell these shares to them. The shares are now up for grabs...but we want to sell them only to blacks in line with our indigenisation policy," one official said.

Anglo American, owners of the nickel mine, offered the government the 22 percent stake in Bindura after President Robert Mugabe charged the mining giant was denying blacks top management positions within the company and failing to help his government advance its efforts to promote black economic empowerment.
The government has not yet bought the Bindura shares.
